ratings.comment: Professor Taber is a true gem of the Economics Dept. This would verified by all graduate students who got a chance to work with him. He is a brilliant researcher, who also invests time in making students. That's what makes him a great Professor. He goes above and beyond what's normally expected of Professors. His work ethics are inspirational.

Powerpoints for lecture are all online, he reads word for word.  He often goes on long tangents about useless information.    Homework involves mathematical problems that he doesn't teach you how to do. Same with exams. DO NOT TAKE.
All the ppts are given online so attending class is not essential.  MC questions on test were random and difficult to study for, essay questions were very fair. HW is graded easily.

Not necessary to attend class especially since all the powerpoints used in lecture are online and he doesn't really add much anyways. However skipping class means you'll miss out on crucial information about Tabes' life. He has a fondness for apple products, empanadas, and fancy powerpoint transitions. Don't ask questions. Answers will not be given
Class sucks...nothing from lecture and never teaches you how to solve problem that you get on exams..dont take

Mediocre. If you read the textbook and come to class with a solid understanding of the concepts you should do well. His lectures are very detailed and I find them hard to soak in without having a grasp of the content before going to lecture.
Loves the material. Spends a lot of time on the theory behind the usage of statistical methods rather than just providing the math.
